title: How to Create a Web Album With PhotoMeister

steps.headline: Select the photos that you want to use for your album.
steps.description: You can have them pre-arranged by having them in one folder or use the 'Import Photos' feature to go to various folders and just select individual images.

steps.headline: Be sure you have a theme.
steps.description: Any album can be a bit boring if you just skip around with no kind of direction.

steps.headline: Click on the Web Album icon .
Select the format of your album.
steps.description: You will want to work with the 'lowest common denominator' of your intended viewers. This means that you want to think about what your viewers may have to view your images. If they aren't computer savvy or techies, there is a chance that they won't have flash. If you want to make sure that there is nothing to keep someone from viewing your album, use HTML. If you want a few more bells and whistles, use Flash.

steps.headline: Start designing your album.
steps.description: Experiment with the various options to see what works best for you and your photos. Remember that what works best for one set of images might not necessarily apply for another set.

steps.headline: Choose a layout.
steps.description: You can preview it and/or you can edit it; depending on your needs and abilities.

steps.headline: Name your web album.
steps.description: You will be able to choose a name for your album and also add comments and a footer. If you know HTML, it has the ability to add links to your album.

steps.headline: Upload your album.
steps.description: PhotoMeister has the ability to upload your album to the Internet using an internal FTP program. You will need to have FTP access to your domain to do this.

text: Download and install PhotoMeister.  Select the photos that you want to use for your album. You can have them pre-arranged by having them in one folder or use the 'Import Photos' feature to go to various folders and just select individual images. Be sure you have a theme. Any album can be a bit boring if you just skip around with no kind of direction. Click on the Web Album icon .  Select the format of your album. You will want to work with the 'lowest common denominator' of your intended viewers. This means that you want to think about what your viewers may have to view your images. If they aren't computer savvy or techies, there is a chance that they won't have flash. If you want to make sure that there is nothing to keep someone from viewing your album, use HTML. If you want a few more bells and whistles, use Flash. Start designing your album. Experiment with the various options to see what works best for you and your photos. Remember that what works best for one set of images might not necessarily apply for another set. Choose a layout. You can preview it and/or you can edit it; depending on your needs and abilities. Name your web album. You will be able to choose a name for your album and also add comments and a footer. If you know HTML, it has the ability to add links to your album. Upload your album. PhotoMeister has the ability to upload your album to the Internet using an internal FTP program. You will need to have FTP access to your domain to do this.
